bibl.title: Letter from Leonard Wood to Mabel H. Lazear, November 4, 1900

div1.p: Wood lauds the work that Lazear did and praises him as a martyr.

div1.head: Letter from Leonard Wood to Mabel H. Lazear, November 4, 1900
div1.opener:
HEADQUARTERS
DIVISION OF CUBA
HAVANA
November 4th, 1900
Mrs. M. H. Lazear.
Windsor. Walbrook. Baltimore. Md.
Dear Madam:-
div1.p:
Enclosed is a letter to the
Adjutant General of the U.S.Army which I
trust will be of service to you. If you
wish any other letter to the Commissioner
of Pensions or any other public official, I
shall be only too glad to give them to you.

Dr. Lazear's work here was of the high-
est character and he gave up his life to
science.
